thread.title: Highly Suspect's 'Impeach' Jacket, ScHoolboy Q's 'Girl Power' Sweater Make Statements on Grammys Red Carpet
thread.title_full: Highly Suspect's 'Impeach' Jacket, ScHoolboy Q's 'Girl Power' Sweater Make Statements on Grammys Red Carpet

author: NHHMS
title: Highly Suspect's 'Impeach' Jacket, ScHoolboy Q's 'Girl Power' Sweater Make Statements on Grammys Red Carpet
text:
Highly Suspect arrives for the 59th Grammy Awards pre-telecast on Feb. 12, 2017 in Los Angeles. 
The band Highly Suspect arrived in a not-so-subtle look. 
The Grammys red carpet was full of statement-making looks, from over-the-top glam gowns ( Katy Perry ) to a pro-Trump “Make America Great Again” gown worn by Joyce Villa. 
The band Highly Suspect — nominated for best rock song for “My Name Is Human”— arrived in comparatively casual ensembles, but they, too had a message to impart. On the back of Johnny Stevens’ black jacket was the word “impeach.” While the trio posed for photos, Stevens turned around while his bandmates, Richard and Ryan Meyer pointed to the script — proving it was no coincidence. 
Political messages have been everywhere this Fashion Week , so it’s no surprise that celebrities are using their ensembles to make their political points. Singer Skylar Grey also had an LED clutch with the words “empowerment” and “equality” scrolling across its face, while ScHoolboy Q wore a pink “Girl Power” top and hit the carpet with his daughter, who was clad in a pink pantsuit. 
— Only Hip Hop Facts (@OnlyHipHopFacts) February 13, 2017 
This article was originally published by Pret-a-Reporter TAGS
